ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: An ok class to take. The classes themselves are a pleasant experience. The readings could be better though.
I will certainly be recommending Anthro 515 to any graduate students next year who are looking for a serious but manageable introduction to anthropology from a historicalperspective.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I got to experience anthropology as a completely new discipline. It helped me to see how anthropologists think about culture, history, and power. Some of the readings took interesting angles on phenomenon.

I suspect Anthro 515 has laid some important methodological groundwork for how I approach research. This was the course which brought together various inchoate and vague ideas about anthropology and pinned them down. In that sense, I will be much more confident in future about asking anthropology-type questions in my research.
